summary: The Prevent Interruptions in Physical Therapy Act of 2025 amends the Social Security Act to allow physical therapists to utilize locum tenens arrangements under Medicare. This change aims to ensure continuity of care for patients receiving outpatient physical therapy services by permitting temporary coverage when a physical therapist is unavailable. The bill cites Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, stating the document is in the public domain.
